alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Botetourt; Craig; Giles (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 10:07AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Thunderstorms with heavy rainfall will impact portions of Alleghany County in west central Virginia, northeastern Giles and Craig Counties in southwestern Virginia, northwestern Botetourt County in west central Virginia and Monroe Counties in southeastern West Virginia as well as the City of Covington through 1045 AM EST... At 1006 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Low Moor to Craig Springs to near Kimballton. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Rainfall of up to one inch an hour. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Rain may flood roadside ditches and wash debris onto the highway. Locations impacted include... Alleghany... Covington... Clifton Forge... Alderson... Peterstown... Union... and New Castle. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
